result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

May have letter contact with co-defendant regarding medical issues regarding unborn child. Letters may be monitored by jail/prison staff.

3:21 PM Defendant Kevin D Komatz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Kevin D Komatz.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Nolan Plutchak is requesting no contact with with Stevie Sullivan by letter regarding unborn child. They do no object to prison/jail staff reviewing letters.
Attorney Zima is objecting to bond being modified and states reasons why.
Court will allow letters between the two defendant regarding pregnancy.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:25 PM Defendant Kevin D Komatz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Brian Machon is sworn and questioned by Attorney Zima. Testifies to employment.  Testifies to executing a search warrant.  Testifies that defendants, Sullivan and Komatz, reside at the residence.  Testifies to the items found in the bedroom of defendants.  Testifies to the items tested and the results of the tests.  Testifies that defendants Komatz and Sullivan made statements regarding the items in the room.  Cross-examination by Attorney Jakobson.  Questions witness regarding additional boxes located in the room.  Questions witness regarding the statements made by both defendants.  

Attorney Zima argues in support of bindover.  Attorney Jakobson argues that the State has not met it's burden on Counts 1 and 2. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that felonies were committed and that defendant Komatz and Sullivan committed them. Bond is continued.  Court takes judicial notice of case nos. 20CF760, 19CF8, 22CF38 and 22CF145.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
1:43 PM Defendant Kevin D Komatz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. Bond continued
No contact with co defendant. Absolute sobriety.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact w/ co-defendant Stevie Sullivan. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Search Warrant; Complaint for Search Warrant; Return of Officer
